metadata.synopsis: Korrilla dialog in Sharess Caress taproom standing next to a bar. "You enter Sharess' Caress and find Korrilla Hearthflame having a drink with Hoots the bartender. "
metadata.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_A, 19; 44; 84Talk to Korrilla near the bar.

17.speaker: Korrilla
17.text: Go see Raphael - then I might let you buy me a drink.

30.speaker: Korrilla
30.text: Damn, Hoots. That new batch burns stronger than a pit fiend's fist.
30.context: NodeContext: talking to the bartender, impressed by the strength of the drink she has just finished (no need to show her drinking it)

51.speaker: Hoots Hooligan
51.text: I'll take that as a compliment.
51.context: NodeContext: smiling, referring to somebody reacting strongly to a drink you just poured them

111.speaker: Korrilla
111.text: Take it however you want, but I'll be having my usual from now on.
111.context: NodeContext: talking to a bartender, just drank a particularly powerful shot and you're impressed but will NOT be drinking it again

173.speaker: Karlach
173.context: NodeContext: Talking about Korilla, servant of Raphael.

142.speaker: Korrilla
142.text: Oh! Raphael's latest client - saviour of the city, he says!
142.context: CinematicNodeContext: turns to playerNodeContext: delighted

45.speaker: Player
45.text: I'm not Raphael's client. He's my pawn.

22.speaker: Korrilla
22.text: Whatever you need to tell yourself, honey. Deep down you know the truth. And so do I.

117.speaker: Korrilla
117.text: You've made his century, you know. You're going to save us, Baldur's Gate - everyone, he says.

177.speaker: Korrilla
177.text: Indeed we do. Seems like an age ago that the boss sent me to keep an eye on you.

181.speaker: Korrilla
181.text: And I must have done a damn fine job because here you are - safe, sound, and already signed up to team Raphael.

59.speaker: Korrilla
59.text: When I'm not keeping my eye on potential clients like you, I make sure the House of Hope is fully secure.

149.speaker: Player
149.text: Surely Raphael can defend his own house.

39.speaker: Korrilla
39.text: When he's there, yes. But he's a busy man - contracts and interests in many places, and on many planes.

141.speaker: Korrilla
141.text: This current crisis has him so busy he's barely been home since he met you.

160.speaker: Player
160.text: Who would be stupid enough to break into a devil's home?

63.speaker: Korrilla
63.text: Devils often have prettier hoards than dragons. Sneaking thieves into their vaults is a lucrative business - doesn't usually end well for the thieves.
63.context: NodeContext: cheerful, but the last phrase has a trace of annoyance. She doesn't like these 'thieves'

87.speaker: Korrilla
87.text: But sometimes the thieves are rich, smart, or well-connected enough to come back in one piece. Take our esteemed Lord Gortash, for example.
87.context: NodeContext: not dropping her cheerful persona, but with some real venom for Lord Gortash. She really doesn't like him

151.speaker: Narrator
151.text: *She's enjoying your company and the liquor has loosened her tongue, but she's anxious about the direction the conversation's taking.*

10.speaker: Player
10.text: Have you ever been tempted to earn some extra coin selling infernal secrets?

62.speaker: Korrilla
62.context: NodeContext: surprised by an accusation of treachery

182.speaker: Korrilla
182.text: I'll take Raphael's secrets to the grave.

66.speaker: Korrilla
66.text: If that prick Gortash came nosing around my turf, I'd tell him to stick his gauntlet where the sun don't shine.

150.speaker: Korrilla
150.text: But somebody helped him out. Some diabolist with a loose sense of duty, and a hunger to be richer than Mammon.
150.context: NodeContext: Bitterly. She is all about duty. 'Mammon' is an archdevil.

105.speaker: Korrilla
105.text: Conversation's over. I've got to sober up and get back to work.
105.context: NodeContext: stern warning - she's telling us to shut up

21.speaker: Korrilla
21.text: I'm insulted you'd even suggest that.

35.speaker: Player
35.text: Gortash must have had help from someone with infernal connections. Any idea who?

83.speaker: Korrilla
83.text: Yeah - a diabolist with a loose sense of duty, and a hunger to be richer than Mammon.
83.context: NodeContext: Bitterly. She is all about duty. 'Mammon' is an archdevil.

108.speaker: Korrilla
108.text: I almost wish he'd asked me. I'd have told him to stick his gauntlet where the sun don't shine, and wiped that smug little grin off his face.

6.speaker: Korrilla
6.text: Same kind of people who'd ask about it. Folks with a death wish.
6.context: NodeContext: stern warning - she's telling us to shut up

15.speaker: Player
15.text: Enough of this - enjoy your drink, and think of lighter things.

183.speaker: Korrilla
183.text: It's hard to find any light in this bloody city.

101.speaker: Korrilla
101.text: I can't wait to get back to the hells - at least it's warm there. The wind off the harbour here cuts me to the bone.
101.context: NodeContext: she's sincere about this, despite how ludicrous it might sound

40.speaker: Korrilla
40.text: I hope things turn out well for you, I really do. Cheers.
40.context: NodeContext: sadly - she knows (but we don't) that things won't turn out well at all

184.speaker: Korrilla
184.text: Talking about this won't end well for either of us, so if you'll excuse me -
184.context: NodeContext: abruptly cutting off a conversatoin that's leading toward controversial topics

12.speaker: Korrilla
12.text: As a noose. Doesn't stop people from testing it, though.
12.context: NodeContext: 'As a noose' is a response to 'security must be tight'. Proudly. She helps out with that security

170.speaker: Player
170.text: You're very enthusiastic - you really like working for Raphael?

46.speaker: Korrilla
46.text: More than anything. My old dwarven master used to beat me and feed me scraps - Raphael treats me right and feeds me well.
46.context: NodeContext: cheerful - explaining why she likes working for a devil

27.speaker: Korrilla
27.text: Better to feast in the Hells than go begging in the Heavens.

153.speaker: Player
153.text: I hope you're right about saving the city.

148.speaker: Korrilla
148.text: The boss is always right. Even though he's so very wrong.
148.context: NodeContext: mischevious - emphasis on 'wrong' is her cheeky acknowledgement that 'the boss' is a devil

24.speaker: Player
24.text: I think I made a bad choice.

4.speaker: Korrilla
4.text: Don't worry - the boss treats his clients right. He's as honest as his life is long.

69.speaker: Korrilla
69.text: Oh! You must have slipped by me earlier. Raphael's very disappointed you turned him down.
69.context: CinematicNodeContext: turns to playerNodeContext: disappointed, but encouraging

115.speaker: Korrilla
115.text: He's gutted you know - had such high hopes for you.

166.speaker: Korrilla
166.text: Laugh all you want, dynamite. You're not coming out of this alive without him. Then again, you probably won't come out alive at all.

171.speaker: Player
171.text: He better get used to disappointment - I'm not making any deal with him.

174.speaker: Korrilla
174.text: You won't come out of this alive without him.

93.speaker: Player
93.text: Did he tell you to try and win me over with your charms?

169.speaker: Korrilla
169.text: Cheeky. We might be in a brothel, but I'm not that kind of gal. You should reconsider, though.

48.speaker: Korrilla
48.text: He knows me - and you - better than that. You should reconsider his offer.

94.speaker: Korrilla
94.text: The boss might be a devil, but he'll treat you more honestly than anyone else in the city.

104.speaker: Player
104.text: What exactly is it you do for him?

176.speaker: Korrilla
176.text: Plenty. But right now, I have one job - you.

152.speaker: Korrilla
152.text: I'm talking to you openly - mortal to mortal - and I'm begging you to sign the contract.

167.speaker: Player
167.text: I doubt that - there are plenty of good people here.

73.speaker: Korrilla
73.text: I'm sure you're right. Between the dictators, the murderers, the Guild, and the cult, the city's brimming with goodness.

113.speaker: Korrilla
113.text: I am. You can save yourself and the city if you sign that contract.

41.speaker: Korrilla
41.text: Listen - because I'll only say this once - this fight isn't just about Baldur's Gate, or the Sword Coast, or even Faerûn.

180.speaker: Korrilla
180.text: If the brain wins, the Illithid Empire returns, and worlds you've never even dreamed of will die.
180.context: NodeContext: insistent, emphasising the scale of the horror

80.speaker: Korrilla
80.text: Raphael can stop it - he wants to - and he knows how. You're the key. You always have been.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: Maybe I rejected him too hastily.

131.speaker: Karlach
131.context: NodeContext: Piping up when the player says 'Maybe I rejected Raphael too easily'

172.speaker: Korrilla
172.text: You did. But that's fine - there's still time.

136.speaker: Player
136.text: Then why make demands of me instead of just helping?

65.speaker: Korrilla
65.text: He's a devil. It's his nature. He needs to get his due.
65.context: CinematicNodeContext: with a shrugNodeContext: matter of fact

128.speaker: Player
128.text: I'll stop the brain without his help.

109.speaker: Korrilla
109.text: I doubt it - but even if you do, you won't survive the fight.
109.context: NodeContext: with a hint of sadness

110.speaker: Korrilla
110.text: I'd reconsider if I were you.

154.speaker: Player
154.text: I don't believe a devil cares about the fate of the world.

7.speaker: Korrilla
7.text: I won't pretend he's an altruist. But he's looked at the balance sheet - no world, no souls.

114.speaker: Korrilla
114.text: And it's hard to get leverage on an illithid - they make terrible clients.
114.context: NodeContext: with a smile, trying to make light of a serious situation

157.speaker: Player
157.text: I'm not convinced - I'll stop the brain without his help.

175.speaker: Korrilla
175.text: Nothing wrong with that. I hope you make the right choice.
175.context: NodeContext: with a shrug, sincere in her hope

102.speaker: Korrilla
102.context: CinematicNodeContext: turns to playerNodeContext: cheerful

52.speaker: Korrilla
52.text: You've put me out of pocket, you know. Raphael bet me five soul coins you'd reach the city in one piece.

50.speaker: Korrilla
50.text: Good to see you again, even if you have put me out of pocket. The boss bet me five soul coins you'd reach the city in one piece.
50.context: NodeContext: cheerful - she bet against us surviving in a 'playful' wager, but is glad to see us nonetheless

53.speaker: Korrilla
53.text: He rented a room upstairs in the hope that you'd drop by.

125.speaker: Korrilla
125.text: Ah, I forget we've never met. I've had my eyes and ears on you so long, we feel like old friends.

70.speaker: Korrilla
70.text: Korrilla is my name. I'm Raphael's... assistant, shall we say.

16.speaker: Player
16.text: No interest in meeting up with devil scum.

72.speaker: Player
72.text: I'll go see him - we have unfinished business.

14.speaker: Korrilla
14.text: Yes, you do - and what better place to do business than in the home of the oldest trade?
14.context: NodeContext: cheerful - 'the oldest trade' is a reference to the brothel she's drinking in

78.speaker: Korrilla
78.text: Take your time - have a drink, sample the goods. Go see him when you're feeling refreshed.

89.speaker: Player
89.text: What does he want with me?

82.speaker: Korrilla
82.text: He wants to help you save the world. What else?
82.context: NodeContext: as if it's the most obvious thing in the world

20.speaker: Player
20.text: He should have stayed home - I have no intention of speaking with him.

146.speaker: Korrilla
146.text: Such a shame - you won't survive without his help, and I'll miss your pretty face.

133.speaker: Korrilla
133.text: At least hear him out - you'll be surprised by what he has to offer.

54.speaker: Karlach
54.text: Something's off about this one. On your guard.

44.speaker: Korrilla
44.text: A toast to Raphael's latest client, the saviour of the city.

3.speaker: Player
3.text: I'm already starting to regret making that deal with him.

47.speaker: Korrilla
47.text: I'm not for sale. My time's not for sale. My affection's not for sale. I'm here on other business.
47.context: CinematicNodeContext: hasn't looked up from her mug yet - is muttering darkly, she's clearly said this to a lot of people who've assumed she's a prostitute (she's standing at the bar in a brothel)

64.speaker: Korrilla
64.text: We'll celebrate together in the House of Hope when the victory's won.

97.speaker: Korrilla
97.text: C'mere - I'm not going to start an argument. I just want to know why you turned the boss down.

100.speaker: Player
100.text: Hah, are you joking? Because I hate him.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: Doesn't matter why. My word is final - no deal.

143.speaker: Player
143.text: Did he tell you to try and win me over with your charms?

122.speaker: Korrilla
122.text: Seen sense yet? Raphael's still waiting. He can still help you get through this.

129.speaker: Korrilla
129.text: There you are. I'd almost lost track of you. Almost.

23.speaker: Korrilla
23.text: Speaking of Raphael - did you miss his invitation? He's waiting for you in Sharess' Caress.

13.speaker: Player
13.text: You know, I think I did miss Raphael.

81.speaker: Korrilla
81.text: Then go un-miss him. And hurry up. Devils are patient by nature, but even Raphael has certain limitations.

134.speaker: Player
134.text: What does he want with me?

75.speaker: Player
75.text: He should have stayed home - I have no intention of speaking with him.

58.speaker: Korrilla
58.text: He'll be in Sharess' Caress in Wyrm's Crossing. Go, now, if you know what's good for you - and the world.

159.speaker: Korrilla
159.text: If it isn't Raphael's latest client - saviour of the city, isn't it?
